column4: here trolly trolly, good little trolly crumbs for you, yum yum,,
what kinda of question is that?
sounds loaded
can you tell me why the clock/weather behaves differently between custom/admin user accnt and "user" accnt?
both are using gnome classic
no
are you connected to the net as Root?
whats the heck is a custom/admin user?
are you saying you have two users, one is custom and the other is a very low privilege user?
when your first user is created... it is "admin" and is under "custom"   when I created the second accnt on the machine.. I put in group "users" only
i undertstand... continue...
how did you put it in? gui or manually
gui
did you use adduser
yes
and you simply put your "other" user in group what?

stop right there!! do not addusers or groups on the fly like that... the way ubuntu/gnome has put things together, its all intertwined, and you really should readup a little bit on perms in a gui b4 treading there...
so your question was, the diff between how the clock/weather is configured? correct
yes.. it there is weather display and pref choices in admin account but not the "user" account
thats cuz the programmers figured they dont want an unpriv user mucking with the clock settings, makes sense
the diff, they are perm'd differently. add weather with the "admin" user, and the "other should be there after logging in
and jstoone   thanks for your time  i'll keep playing with this
